modules.description: Provides functions to integrate Fiber-based asynchronous code with Lwt, including running Fiber computations as Lwt promises and converting callback-style Lwt functions into Fiber-compatible results. Operates with Lwt.t and Fiber.t types, enabling seamless interaction between the two concurrency models. Used to bridge Fiber-based libraries with Lwt-based code in mixed environments.

Provides functions for converting between Lwt and Fiber monads, including `bind`, `return`, and `catch` operations. Works with Lwt promises and Fiber threads, enabling interoperability between asynchronous execution models. Enables seamless integration of Lwt-based code with Fiber-based systems in concurrent applications.

Integrates Fiber and Lwt concurrency models by converting between Lwt.t and Fiber.t, allowing asynchronous operations to interoperate. Supports running Fiber computations as Lwt promises and adapting Lwt callbacks into Fiber results. Enables seamless interaction between libraries using either model. For example, a Fiber-based API can be invoked from Lwt code, and Lwt functions can be used within Fiber workflows.
